summary: Gracie Mansion is where the mayor of New York City lives. Built in 1799, it's in Manhattan's Yorkville neighborhood, overlooking the East River. The original house was built by Archibald Gracie and later used as a museum before becoming the mayoral residence in 1942. It has been renovated several times and now includes an annex with a ballroom. The mansion is a historic landmark and offers public tours. Each mayor usually redecorates it when they move in.
title: Gracie Mansion
